result.execSummary:
The defendant Cordell A. Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Endanger Safety/Reckless Use of Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.    ++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. 
++ Pay restitution plus surcharges. All costs due within 30 days or civil judgment. May Not have contact with Christopher W, Cathy B, Tenesha B unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May Not possess any firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  200 -   Victim rights compliance. Sentence recommendations. Court rules as follows:

Ct1:  Defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP; 2.5 years Initial Confinement followed by 2.5 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to Ct2.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Ct2:  Defendant is sentenced to 10 years in the WSP; 5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to 13CF852.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Ct3:  Defendant is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct2.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Ct4:  Defendant is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 1 year of Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct2, 5.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Ct5:  Defendant is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 1 year of Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct2, 4.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge on all counts and notice is given. Court costs ordered - due within 30 days or civil judgment. $135 in restitution ordered - Order signed this day. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

NO RECORD MADE
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears by Atty David Celebre. No appearance by DE.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  131 - DE's appearance waived. DE is in WSP on another file, and he was not writted for this hearing. SEH will be set over to another date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm. (ps 11/7/16)

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State and KPD Det. Dan DeJonge. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  817 - Court reviews verdict instructions out of the jury's prescence. Atty Celebre requests modification of instruction to include a specific offense date. ST objects. Discussion held. For reasons set forth on the record, Court denies Atty Celebre's request. 
DAY 2:  Trial resumes at 9:10am. Jurors brought in. ST rests. Defense presents no witnesses - DE rests. Exhibits #1-3 offered and rec'd by the Court. Defense presents no witnesses - DE rests. Jurors instructed on principals of law.
Clerk/H.Barnett.  Closing arguments.  Alternate juror is #4413, excused at 11:09am.  Jurors deliberate at 11:10am.
 
Clerk P. Scypta.  Jury has reached a verdict - returned at 12:52pm.   Verdict: guilty on all counts. Jurors polled and released at 1:15pm. ST moves for judgment on the verdict and revocation of bond. Court finds the DE guilty on all counts - **BOND REVOKED**. PSI ordered. Sentencing scheduled June 16, 2016 @ 1:30pm in Rm 336.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State with KPD Det. Dan DeJonge. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  915 - Parties prepared to proceed. Witnesses sequestered. 
DAY 1: Jurors brought in, sworn and pre-instructed. Opening statements. State's case presented. Witnesses sworn and testified: KPD Officer J. Kunz, Christopher W., KPD Officer B. Ruha, Cathy B., Tenesha B., KPD Officer V. Lang, KPD Det. L. Anschutz, KPD Officer S. Morton, KPD Criminalist Det. T. Thorne, KPD Det. D. DeJonge. Exhibits 1-23 marked; Jury excused for break at 10:18am. Waiver hearing held. Court finds DE voluntarily waives his right to have Ct3 proven by the ST. Trial resumes at 10:33am. Court breaks for lunch at 11:51am. Trial resumes at 1:26pm. Jurors removed from the court. Court conducts colloquy w/DE re: testimony. DE exercises right to remain silent/not to testify - Court so finds. Jury returns for testimony at 2:51pm. Exhibits #4-23 rec'd by the Court. Exhibits #19, 20 published for the jury. Jury is excused for the evening at 3:56pm. Court addresses legal issues re: verdict/jury instructions. Trial to resume 5/4/16 @ 9am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
and Peremptory Challenges

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State with KPD Det. Dan DeJonge. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  858 - Pre-trial discussion held. Jurors sworn-in and instructed on principals of law. Voir dire begins. Jury of 13 impaneled - to be sworn prior to commencement of testimony on 5/3/16. Unselected jurors are returned to Jury Clerk to be recycled at 10:24am. Parties stipulate to DE's prior conviction. Jury waiver from DE to be held on 5/3.
Per Attys Celebre and Graveley - Ludwig hearing not needed. 4/22 MH removed from court's calendar.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  930 - DE is ready to proceed. ST states 2 civilian witnesses have not appeared as ordered under personal service of a subpooena. ST is unaware of the witnesses whereabouts. DE has filed a speedy trial demand on this case and requests dismissal. Court denies DE's motion to dismiss. Material Witness warrants may be issued. ST requests $500 cash bonds on both warrants - DE objects. Court sets bond on warrants at $500. Any negotiated resolution to be filed no later than 4/25. Atty Celebre moves for modification of bond due to speedy trial not being met, requests bond be modified to signature. ST objects. Arguments heard. For reasons set forth on the record, Court denies any modification of bond. DDA Graveley to prepare material witness warrants. Ludwig Hearing scheduled 4/22/16 @ 1:15pm. Jury selection scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:00 am. Jury trial scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 09:00 am. (ps 3/2/16)

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:   1016 -   Victim rights compliance.  Parties report they are prepared for JT on 2/29.  DDA Graveley reports status of Motions in Limine filed by Atty Celebre - amendments stipulated by parties and approved by court. Atty Celebre has reviewed the new evidence named in the last hearing. DDA Graveley shall prepare a transcript of any portion they intend to use in trial, and is to provide it to Atty Celebre by 2/19/16. If DE intends to use any recordings, Atty Celebre is ordered the same.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  844 - Hearing scheduled at the court's request to hold discussion on bond modification due the speedy trial demand filed by the DE and adjournment request made at the last hearing by the ST. The ST opposes the modification of the DE's bond to signature. DE feels that DE should be eligible for modification since the adjournment was given putting the timeline of the demand in jeopardy. Arguments heard. Court finds that the ends of justice outweigh the demand for a speedy trial and denies any modification of the bond at this time.
Hearing scheduled per request from Judge re: SB

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  953 - DDA Graveley reports that new discovery issues have presented - cites 971.10(3).  DE has not yet had the opportunity to review discovery, and ST has no objection to an adjournment. DE has filed a speedy trial demand, though the DE is not eligible for release from custody due to other holds.  Court grants adjournment and waives the untimely filing of DE's motions in limine.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine filed by Atty Celebre
filed by Atty Celebre
filed by Atty Celebre

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  347 - Matter heard with 15CF899. DDA Graveley has not had the opportunity to file a written response to Atty Celebre's motion, as it was only rec'd late Friday, though he is prepared to argue the motion this day.  Arguments heard.  For reasons set forth on the record, the Court rules that cases 15CF897 & 15CF899 shall remained separated. ST's motion for consolidation is denied.
Opposing Consolidation filed by Atty Celebre

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  234 - Matter heard with 15CF899.  Victim rights compliance. Court reviews ST's motion. Atty Celebre has not submitted a response or affidavit for the file. Atty Celebre is ordered to file objections in writing no later than 1/8/16. Court adjourns.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 204 -  State is compliant with victim rights notification. DE has filed a speedy trial demand and is ready to proceed on both cases. DE opposes consolidation of cases with 15CF899 due to a conflict with witnesses. Court orders all witness lists and motions in limine be filed by 1/4/16.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand filed by Atty Celebre. FPT rescheduled to 11/25 @ 1:30pm Rm 100. Parties notified by email.
filed by Atty Celebre
for Substitution of Counsel (Atty David Celebre for Atty Hilary Edwards)

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Celebre is substituting in as defense counsel in place of Atty Hilary Edwards.  Atty Celebre requests time to investigate and discuss case with def.  FPT 12/11/15 at 10:00.  Atty Celebre indicates he may be filing a suppression motion after reviewing police records.  Bond continued.

Defendant Cordell A. Ford appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  ST called witness KPD J. Kunz; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Edwards. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Atty:  H Edwards.
